editorialSummary.text: Plush hotel featuring refined quarters, a posh restaurant & a spa, plus a champagne bar.

text.text:
My stay at this hotel was a bittersweet experience which leads me to share an honest review. Let's start with the positive aspects: the cleanliness of the hotel is truly impeccable. Every corner shone with neatness, which is worthy of praise:.
Special recognition deserves the breakfast as it offered a wide variety of options that would satisfy any palate. The quality of the food is excellent and is the highlight of this establishment.
However, the disappointing part of my visit was the interaction with the staff. Despite the high expectations I had for the quality of the hotel, the treatment by the employees was not up to par. I had the impression that only someone who arrives in a Ferrari or a Rolls Royce is worthy of exceptional kindness.
A hotel of this category should offer equally excellent treatment to all its guests, regardless of their mode of transportation. This was a negative point in my experience, as customer service should be a priority in any luxury establishment.
All in all, if you value cleanliness and high-quality food, this hotel has a lot to offer. However, if you expect friendly and attentive treatment from the staff, you may be disappointed, unless you arrive in a luxury vehicle.

text.text:
I had a wonderful stay at the Fairmont. They were very accommodating and sensitive to my needs. I went from the hospital to the hotel and the staff did everything in their power to make sure I was comfortable.

A big thank you to Jean Michell who really went the extra mile. I wasn’t able to leave my room due to my surgery and he was always so helpful and kind.

A big thank you.

places.adrFormatAddress: 30 Av. Aristide Briand, 06500 Menton, France

editorialSummary.text: Lauded hillside restaurant with a refined ambiance offering a creative fixed-price menu & sea views.

text.text:
Had an amazing 9-course diner with wine pairing !
We were sitting in the kitchen (there is a table sitting up to 8 people right next to the chefs, separate from other guests), adding something very special to the experience.
Everyone was extremely friendly, professional, and made an effort to fit our group's mindset. Special thanks to the sommelier who spent an incredible amount of time answering our questions, understanding our expectations in tasting a variety of "less-known" wines, with some incredible discoveries.
Everything from start to finish was on point. The menu was designed around roots (turmeric, beetroots, ginger, turnip etc.) to match the season. The idea was to explore the interactions between "heaven and earth". Dishes were full of surprising flavors, with every combination matching perfectly.
It lasted around four hours from start to finish, including a tour of the wine cellar, but felt like an hour and an half. Will be hard to beat !

text.text:
We were there for dinner. Overall it was a big disappointment. This place doesn't deserve its 3 Michelin stars (maybe one) or being anywhere in the top spots of La Liste.

I'll start with the positive parts: the view of Menton is superb. Some of the dishes we had were indeed very very good (the amuse-bouche, the Salade Marine with caviar, the Epinard Malabar Gamberoni from San Remo).

However there were many issues:
- no tablecloths, shocking for the price they charge. The tables are too close to each other.
- the service was sub-par (brasserie level). They forgot to pour the wine before bringing the plates, I ordered an extra glass of wine which arrived 30' later, they were clearing the plates and cutlery from the left. Lots of personnel in the dining room but very poorly coordinated.
- my main concern, the plates became less and less enjoyable as we advanced through the menu. The aged tuna tartare with capucine could have been excellent, save that its taste was drowned by too much yuzu/ponzu spice on top. The salad with seafood sauce should not be served in any starred restaurant - just by the look of it its place is maybe in a brasserie. The lobster with marjolaine was ok but uninspiring. The hay-cooked fish with porcini could have been excellent - both the fish and the porcini shavings were superb; however, the cooked porcini was completely tasteless. The guinea fowl was bland, and it came with two "satellite dishes" that did not fit at all with the main dish. Finally the red cabbage-based desert was "interesting" but not a great way to close the dinner.
- while comprehensive, the wine list has very limited choice between EUR 100-300. Prices are up to 5x store price for the wines.

The location is stunning - dinner while watching the sunset over Menton …. Food was just incredible, we were there for the fruit menu - definitely go for the cheese and wine pairing.

text.text:
2021 Best Restaurant of the world, 3 Michelin stars. It had some big expectations to fill.

We were greeted warmly and offered to freshen up in their bathrooms (the right two are uniquely designed). Then up to our table which had a centerpiece made up from the theme of our visit "roots". They change themes based on the moon position, which really means there are 4 rotating menus. My wife love roots, so this was an opportunity to explore them.

Start to finish the food was delicious and we'll prepared. They served us and gave great English descriptions of the food.

There are 3 different wine pairings. We went with the history of the vines/wine pairings since it was described as unconventional. It was lovely with wines from all over the world.

Food highlights were the chefs grandma's bread, beet that was so tender with cream and caviar, sea bream that was the best fish I've ever had, and an stunning savory carrot pie. Presentation and service was top notch. We ended up being their almost 4 hours.

An excellent experience, that we'll remember. I'd keep in mind that if you're picky or don't like roots, you probably shouldn't go during that time, but that should be self explanatory...

editorialSummary.text: Luxe, individually decorated quarters, plus a gourmet restaurant with sea views & terraces.

text.text: Our stay at Chateau Eze was spectacular. The attention to detail that the staff pays to its guests is a measure by which we have used for all other hotels we have stayed at, and they all fall short! The very first night, our flight was extremely delayed, but the front desk staff waited until we got there at 10 pm to show us our GORGEOUS room, a romantic spread for our honeymoon, and even found some food for us because we hadn’t eaten all day! The hotel itself is nestled into this beautiful town, our room was indistinguishable from the landscape and cliff side into the beautiful harbor. It was incredibly private and so romantic! Every time we left and returned from our room, the front desk staff was so cheerful and thoughtful. They had excellent recommendations, they knew when we were leaving so cleaning staff could come in, and were so genuinely nice. I can’t wait to come back to this place again. Truly a 7 star experience.

text.text: We were here last year as well and the truffle pasta was great so decided to come back and try a bit more of the menu. The truffle pasta was delicious this time as well and the arancini were good, but everything else, unfortunatly not. The potatoes were hard like rock as if they were from 2 days ago. We almost didn’t touch the dessert as it wasn’t good at all- a hard piece pf pastry. As for the service- had to find the guy myself to tell him what I want and had to ask 3x for them to bring me a baby chair- even after they brought the food for the baby. A bit of a dissapointment.

text.text:
Truly exceptional, I believe it's the best restaurant experience I've had to date, and I dine out quite often. We ate there last night and stayed long after for drinks.

From the very first moment, the service was extraordinarily quick and exceptionally friendly. Our waitress perfectly balanced personal attention and speed; she was highly alert to our needs, whether we wanted to ask a question or place an order. I'm still amazed at how she managed to do that consistently.

The food was delicious (and also served so quickly!) and the cocktail that the bartender specially made for my dish was wonderfully matched.

After dinner, we were having another drink and the terrace was filled with other reservations, but they solved this brilliantly by creating an extra table for us outside.
A wonderful blend of everything and a perfect ending to our evening.

Excellent outlet near the Rainier Palais in Monaco. Good food, helpful staff and lovely sitting area. The location is very convenient for a break before or after visiting the Palais. It's also the start/ end of an excellent underground shortcut to Monaco Monte Carlo train station.

The decor looks a bit tired though. Could add a few pictures on the wall or have it decorated with some murals to attract the crowd.

text.text: It’s nice to see an American business presence in Monaco. On our day trip to Monte Carlo, we wanted some quick coffee to start the day. editorialSummary.text: Sophisticated luxury hotel featuring a spa, an outdoor pool & a private beach, plus restaurants.

text.text: We were in this hotel a while ago. It’s really a great one! I loved the breakfast with such an amazing sea view! It was so relaxing! For a breakfast you have a great choice of fresh products. We decided to get a dinner there as well! And we do not regret! It was really great choice! If you are looking for a hotel with great view… amazing surroundings I would recommend this one!

originalText.text: We were in this hotel a while ago. It’s really a great one! I loved the breakfast with such an amazing sea view! It was so relaxing! For a breakfast you have a great choice of fresh products. We decided to get a dinner there as well! And we do not regret! It was really great choice! If you are looking for a hotel with great view… amazing surroundings I would recommend this one!

text.text:
We received our first room on time (3 pm) and the second room at around 5 pm as the previous tenant had a guaranteed late check out at 4. But the reception staff Nicholas was nice to offer us an upgrade for one of the rooms. It was slightly more spacious than the  original one.
Rooms are a bit dated and in my opinion don’t live up to the nightly price level.
Breakfast buffet while relatively small was amazing with high quality items. Service was great as expected.
The swimming pool is nice, clean and classy with great service too.
A major disappointment was the beach. The only good thing about it is the view of sea and hills in the background, otherwise the water is among the most unclean I have ever seen in the French Riviera. The water is full of leaves, candy wrappers, paper, other objects…
There is a boat with huge nets trying to keep it clean but the water condition is surprisingly still not acceptable. The neighboring public beach offers a better swimming experience!!

On checkout, we asked for a late checkout but we were offered an extra hour only for one of the rooms despite our late check in…

Finally, the concierge desk was very helpful with advice and booking events.
All in all, a good stay if you want luxury dining and a nice pool experience but if you are looking for a good beach or a luxurious room then you may be disappointed.

text.text:
Very welcome-looking personnel  at the reception. Very nice restaurant Jasmin with excellent service. Clean rooms. Private beach…
But:
1.	Housekeeping(( They do not see any problem if your room is not made until 4 pm! Even if the plate are on the door from 11. You have to contact them and discuss time of room cleaning if you want to be sure that the room are made before 4 pm.
2.	Beach is really small and when its full you are almost touching your neighbors
3.	It is not easy to adjust required water temperature from the shower tap. We had two rooms in two different buildings, but both have the problem.
4.	Should be very careful with the room selection. Railway and roads are very near. And if you are looking for really quite place - it is not about. Honestly speaking, if you room is not railway view, you can hardly hear  the train. But  outside the room you will definitely feel yourself as in in-city hotel.
5.	Unfortunately they did not use neither a/c nor fans for at the restaurants during our stay, and when it was hot outside and terraces were full it was a real challenge to have breakfast or lunch inside…
6.	There are neither coffee machine nor kettle in the room by default. They are by request. Be prepared that tea and coffee they will not add to your basket every room cleaning. You have to ask house keeping and probably remind them after.
7.	Be careful if you choose Orange Mansion when it’s rainy. On out last night we wake up from the water noise and found out that the water was coming to our room from the corridor. Nobody came to help or offer another room. So we dried our room by ourselves.  Again they did not see big problem, we did not get any apologies for “inconvenience”…

Hope you will not meet all of these points once you will be charming by Cote D’Azur and if you stay one or two nights. But for longer stay I would not recommend this hotel - too many issues(((

text.text:
This is an absolutely wonderful luxury hotel, among the nicest I have ever visited. Top notch service from the staff and a beautiful, well kept property. The breakfast was amazing with lots of local products, cheeses, an omelet station etc. Onsite food & drinks are expensive, but it matches the hotel quality and setting; in any case, there are many other food options within a short walk, in Beaulieu-sur-Mer, which also includes a train station from where you can quickly reach Nice or Monaco.

I recommend any visitors also take a walk or short drive to visit the Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild and its amazing gardens.

editorialSummary.text: Airy accommodations with private balconies & sea views in an elegant hotel offering a pool & a spa.

text.text:
I went for a spa day, lunch and massage.
I really enjoyed the spa. For the massage, Emilie was wonderful. I came in with neck muscle spasms and shoulder issues and her technique and deep tissue massage made all the difference. This is my first time in Terrasses d’Eze. Very clean establishment and excellent service.
I really appreciated the attention to detail of Emilie when adjusting different body parts and stretching or massaging as needed, and in a way that can actually help your pain points feel better. Compared to a massage done previously, my experience here seemed much more therapeutic and would provide lasting results for the next few days. I highly recommend and will definitely come back!

The view is beautiful, gorgeous on the water access as well as the tunnel under the road and railway if you arrive by car/on foot.

text.text:
Wow! Genuinely one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. We went for Sunday lunch, the food was absolute perfection….the set menu was more than enough but our table of 6 treated ourselves with extra lobster, Wagyu and ribs.

The service staff were very attentive and friendly. At first we thought it was a very classy and subdued environment but after an hour once the drinks were just starting to take effect on came the music played by the DJ, brilliant tunes that built to the point people were dancing on seats and tables! There was also a fantastic singer who went around every table making the afternoon unforgettable. Not to forget the 3 dancers who again put on a personal show for each table if that’s what they wanted.

Truly an afternoon we won’t forget.

Do want to quickly say however that a lot of recent 1 star reviews put us off however the service, food and atmosphere was simply fantastic. If these people are saying it used to be much better then I can only imagine how good it must have been before.

Don’t listen to these reviews….go for it, you won’t regret it!

Ps….don’t forget a thick wallet…and your dancing shoes! 🤑💃🏽🕺

text.text: We spent the whole day here and had a nice lunch here, however Shocking lack of care towards customers, after paying 120 euro for two sunbeds I was woken up while asleep on the sunbeds and nearly blinded by a parasol which was obviously not secured properly and fell on my eye (the base was to small to prevent falling over in the wind), after complaining I was offered alcohol, when I politely declined the alcohol & explained that my concern was I nearly lost my eyesight and this is a future accident waiting to happen I asked to speak to the owner. The owner turned up but was really not very polite at all to us and not interested, Not a good experience at all.

text.text:
This hidden gem located on the French Riviera at #Eze, is tucked away at the beach behind the rails, accessible through a secret tunnel and called Definitely The Most Expensive Beach In The World. I don't know about that, but it is undoubtedly the coolest one. With a laid-back and relaxed atmosphere, waves gently rolling onto the pebbled beach one after another, it exudes tranquility and offers breathtaking views of the coastline. After soothing our tired minds with the sounds of the sea and enjoying an #apero, it was time to peruse the menu. Instantly, I knew we had come to the right place. Barrette Rouge opted for the mouthwatering #LobsterLinguine, while the mysterious mademoiselle behind the scenes chose the delicate Pink #Shrimp Bouquet. Both dishes were simply delicious. This is one of those restaurants that you will not forget and will want to visit over and over again whenever you get the chance.

Don't give up if you can't find the entrance to the tunnel; ask the locals, and they will gladly guide you.

places.adrFormatAddress: Place du Casino, 98000 Monaco

text.text:
Ambience is eye catching right away. It gives me the vibes of Tao night club in Vegas with a big Buddh Statue. It is nicely decorated inside is spacious. I could give the place 6 stars if I could. It’s beautiful and is a great place to get together for drinking or just having that date with special someone.
The food was ok to me. I got the modern California rolls which I thought was good. The shrimp with red Thai spicy curry was a but salty to me because it wasn’t served with rice, and drank the curry soup and it was salty. The shrimp would have been a little better if it wasn’t too breaking a part too much. Other than that, the taste was good, just a bit on the saly side.
Got the Wok fried beef with Thai basil, along with some sesame noodles. Ok, noodles were cooked right, soft and not starchy, but my beef was just wayyyy to salty in my opinion. Dont get me wrong, the taste is good, if only the chef went easy on the salt then it would be perfect. Im a person that eats really salty food, my food has to be flavorful, and I can drink fish sauce.. but if I can’t even try to finish, then it was not made for my palate. Service was excellent. Food came out all together at once very quickly per our request. Music was played just right, not too loud. Overall, nice experience. I would come back again to try the rest of the menus.

text.text:
The atmosphere is the biggest selling point! Service is good, food is good, but I think best for drinks to enjoy the space and then dinner elsewhere.

Walking in, you’re immediately wowed by the lighting, decor, and lounge style seating. The staff are very friendly and helpful, greeting you and helping you get seated. I came in solo without a reservation and easily got a seat at the bar.

Cocktails are very good but expensive (this is Monte Carlo after all). Definitely worth the splurge for a signature cocktail though, in my opinion.

I ordered two appetizers - the calamari and the chicken gyoza with truffle sauce. The gyoza were delicious; perfectly thin wrappers and very flavorful. The sauce went with them beautifully. The calamari was average. A bit too chewy, and the sauce leaned a bit too acidic.

This place is definitely worth a visit for the WOW factor and some great cocktails!

The vibes from the people, the stunning interior... I really recommend! Make sure you make a reservation online cause it would be hard to get in without one.

text.text:
The Best Dining Experience in Monaco!
Amazing food and exceptional atmosphere!

Live DJ, fresh made to order sushi 🍣 and incredible ambiance. It is located in the heart of Monaco at the end of the casino.

Reservations were easy to make via the website. Arrived and was promptly seated without further wait times.
The staff offered extensive knowledge of menu options.

Outside bar area for before/after dinner beverages was also lively and impressive.
Highly recommended for anyone traveling to Monaco.

The dessert menu could have more options.

text.text: Outstanding restaurant with gourmet standard food, the ingredients were so fresh and cooked to perfection. No exaggeration, PERFECTION! The seafood in the red fish curry melts in your mouth like butter and the sushi l’Asie was the best of them all. Salmon tartare had a vibrant gel and delicious delicate flavors. You get a value for the price! The music, ambience, crowd that dines here, and VIEW of Larvotto beach are all amazing. Do not miss this restaurant if you are at Larvotto. Thanks for the great food!

editorialSummary.text: Traditional fare served in an elegant brasserie that has art nouveau-style decor & a roomy terrace.

text.text: The interior of this establishment is truly stunning, offering a feast for the eyes with its exquisite design. The culinary experience here surpasses expectations, as each dish tantalizes the taste buds with its delightful flavors. The overall ambiance is nothing short of marvelous, creating an inviting and luxurious atmosphere. One of the highlights is the terrace view, which presents a breathtaking panorama of the casino and the vibrant Monte Carlo. The espresso served is exceptional, characterized by its rich aroma and robust flavor. Furthermore, the staff’s courtesy and attentiveness significantly enhance the dining experience, making it an absolute pleasure.

text.text:
Great food great experience! Absolutely beautiful decor in the restaurant. I had very few options as I don’t eat non halal meat which Monaco restaurants barely accommodate to but I went for the simple options for ‘Crispy Squid’ which was great with a Penne Arrabbiata and a side of Fries.
Unfortunately I missed out on the party vibe which begins after midnight but definitely recommend to start dinner around 10:30-11pm and continue your night there to party.

Good Service
Good Food

text.text:
The SASS Cafe is a fantastic venue that offers top-notch food and entertainment. As soon as I stepped into the restaurant, I was impressed by its elegant decor and relaxed atmosphere.

The food was sensational, with each dish carefully prepared and presented. I had the pleasure of trying the homemade pasta, which was perfectly al dente and served with a delightful sauce. The appetizers were excellent as well, especially the fresh fish carpaccio marinated in olive oil and lemon juice.

After dinner, I was able to enjoy myself in the club area of SASS Cafe. The music was great, and the atmosphere was electrifying. The cocktails were excellent, especially the signature drinks created specifically for SASS Cafe.

Overall, my visit to SASS Cafe was an unforgettable experience. The food was fantastic, and the club area was a great place to wind down the evening. I highly recommend SASS Cafe to anyone looking to have a great time.

text.text:
This was the best fast food burger I have ever had. It beats shake shack, five guys, McDonald's, etc. The meat was perfectly juicy and seasoned. Bun was soft but still had structure.

The fries are quite different than normal. Most of them are very short but oh so crispy, which, is perfect if you order them with sauce on top.

While a small thing, it was nice to get a drink in a reusable plastic cup instead of flimsy one way cups. Also being given a fork to eat the fries with was really nice.

Service was amazing. The waitress checked in on us throughout the meal and as I was cleaning my tray, asked me if everything was alright.

Hard to put into words how good everything here was and at a really good price. Meal was about the same price you'd pay at McDonald's but competes in a completely different league.

The service of table is delivered by gentle staff, on any table available (choose outside by the downtown, avoid the tables right next the market, smells in the afternoon). Avoid: McChocoNut, in a place where is really hot in the summer.
